meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the embryoids under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The embryoids in the petri dish were growing steadily.
meanings.sent3: The embryoids seemed to be playing hide and seek in the lab.
meanings.sent4: The embryoids were like tiny seeds waiting to sprout into life.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a model to explain the concept of embryoids to the students.

meanings.definition: A structure resembling an embryo, especially in early stages of development
meanings.sent1: The artist created a sculpture that looked like embryoids.
meanings.sent2: The mysterious object found in the forest resembled embryoids.
meanings.sent3: The cake decoration accidentally ended up looking like embryoids.
meanings.sent4: The clouds in the sky formed shapes similar to embryoids.
meanings.sent5: The garden gnome had a hat that resembled embryoids growing on it.
